abstract: Based on sales for the first half of 2008, Toyota appears to be on its way to surpassing G.M. as the largest automaker.
snippet: Based on sales for the first half of 2008, Toyota appears to be on its way to surpassing G.M. as the largest automaker.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Toyota Motor sold nearly 300,000 more vehicles than General Motors in the first half of 2008 and appeared to be on its way to ending G.M.’s 77-year rule as the world’s largest automaker.

headline.main: Toyota Ahead of G.M. in Auto Sales
headline.print_headline: In First Half, Toyota Sells More Vehicles Than G.M.
